info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 2:50PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Evangeline, southern Avoyelles and northeastern St. Landry Parishes through 330 PM CST... At 249 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hessmer to near Morrow to near Ville Platte. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ville Platte, Bunkie, Simmesport, Melville, Moreauville, Palmetto, Bayou Current, Morrow, Cottonport, Mansura, Hessmer, Evergreen, Plaucheville, Goudeau, Indian Lake, Chicot State Park, Whiteville, Big Cane, Dupont and Big Bend. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 27 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
